alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Niagara; Northern Erie; Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 4:30AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CHAUTAUQUA...SOUTHERN ERIE...NIAGARA...AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile will move into the Niagara Frontier and areas near Lake Erie early this morning. Winds gusting to over 50 mph will produce extensive blowing and drifting snow with very poor visibility. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...A band of heavy snow over Lake Erie will move into the Niagara Frontier and areas near the Lake Erie shore through 530 AM. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Dunkirk, Fredonia, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Grand Island and Evans. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 61 and 49. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Chautauqua; Niagara; Northern Erie; Southern Erie
